intro: Echeandia terniflora var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved echeandia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
